titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Marilyn Monroe Exhibition Photographs PASC.0243
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by UCLA Library Performing Arts Special Collections staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Elizabeth Graney, Julie Graham and Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-10-05 11:13:56 -0700.

physdesc.extent: (7 flat boxes and 5 oversize flat boxes)

did.abstract: Norman Mailer and Lawrence Schiller published the book, Marilyn Pictures by the World's Foremost Photographers, ca. 1973. The collection consists of a set of original photographic art prints (oversize and poster size) of Marilyn Monroe as displayed in Peri's Pictures' Marilyn Monroe Exhibition.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Marilyn Monroe Exhibition Photographs (Collection PASC 243). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by UCLA Library Performing Arts Special Collections staff.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Norman Mailer and Lawrence Schiller published the book, Marilyn: Pictures by the World's Foremost Photographers, ca. 1973. To promote the publication, photographs were generated from the book and used in three exhibitions titled, Marilyn Monroe: The Legend, The Truth. Peri's Pictures acquired the exhibits' photographs which were displayed at Peri's Santa Monica Gallery under the title, Marilyn Monroe Exhibition (ca. 1970s-1980s).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of a set of original photographic art prints of Marilyn Monroe as displayed in Peri's Pictures', Marilyn Monroe Exhibition. Includes oversize and poster size photographic prints most which were originally found in the publication, Marilyn Monroe: The Legend, The Truth. Includes images originally created ca. 1945-ca. 1952 by photographers such as Eve Arnold, George Barris, John Bryson, Andre de Dienes, Milton Greene, Lawrence Schiller, Sam Shaw and others. Whenever possible the processor has tried to identify the photographer.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is loosely arranged by what appears to be the photographer.

controlaccess.occupation: Motion picture actors and actresses -- United States -- Archives.

did.unittitle: Booklet, promotional material, and exhibit catalogue for "Marilyn Monroe: The Legend and the Truth" exhibit at the David Stuart Galleries; poster promoting a month of Marilyn Monroe movies at the Beverly Canon theater.
